â–¶ï¸ Resigned from Your Job in the UAE? Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Hereâ€™s what to keep in mind:ðŸ”¹ Your personal bank account remains active as long as: â€“ Your contact details are up to date with the bank, or â€“ Youâ€™re still using the account (for financial or even non-financial transactions).ðŸ”¹ Under UAE Central Bank rules, your account is only considered dormant if: â€“ There's been no activity for 3 years, and â€“ You haven't contacted the bank in that time.ðŸ”¹ After resigning and cancelling your employment visa: â€“ Your account can still be used, but may be reclassified as a non-resident account. â€“ Terms and conditions might change depending on your residency status.ðŸ’¡ Planning to start your own business? â€“ Once your company is registered, you can open a corporate bank account. â€“ Transferring funds from your personal to your corporate account is allowedâ€”just keep documentation for compliance and transparency. â€“ Inform your bank about your business plans and visa status for smoother processing.âœ¨ Pro Tip: Stay in touch with your bank throughout your transition. Dubai thrives on neutrality. As global powers shift, investors seek safe harbors. The cityâ€™s diversification beyond oilâ€”into tech, trade, and tourismâ€”makes it resilient.Every market has risks, but Dubaiâ€™s foresightâ€”coupled with tools like strategic reinvestment and data-driven lendingâ€”helps investors turn challenges into wins. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Hereâ€™s what to keep in mind:ðŸ”¹ Your personal bank account remains active as long as: â€“ Your contact details are up to date with the bank, or â€“ Youâ€™re still using the account (for financial or even non-financial transactions).ðŸ”¹ Under UAE Central Bank rules, your account is only considered dormant if: â€“ There's been no activity for 3 years, and â€“ You haven't contacted the bank in that time.ðŸ”¹ After resigning and cancelling your employment visa: â€“ Your account can still be used, but may be reclassified as a non-resident account. â€“ Terms and conditions might change depending on your residency status.ðŸ’¡ Planning to start your own business? â€“ Once your company is registered, you can open a corporate bank account. â€“ Transferring funds from your personal to your corporate account is allowedâ€”just keep documentation for compliance and transparency. â€“ Inform your bank about your business plans and visa status for smoother processing.âœ¨ Pro Tip: Stay in touch with your bank throughout your transition. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

ðŸ”¹ UAE HR FAQ â€“ Day 52ðŸ”¹ Wage Calculation for Piecework Workers â€“ Article 23â“ How is the wage calculated for workers on a piecework basis? âœ… It is calculated based on the average earnings received by the worker during the actual working days in the past 6 months.â“ When is this calculation method applied? âœ… This method is used when a worker raises a request or claim related to their wage.â“ Does it matter if the worker had inconsistent earnings? âœ… Yes. The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

ðŸ”¹ UAE HR FAQ â€“ Day 52ðŸ”¹ Wage Calculation for Piecework Workers â€“ Article 23â“ How is the wage calculated for workers on a piecework basis? âœ… It is calculated based on the average earnings received by the worker during the actual working days in the past 6 months.â“ When is this calculation method applied? âœ… This method is used when a worker raises a request or claim related to their wage.â“ Does it matter if the worker had inconsistent earnings? âœ… Yes. The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Hereâ€™s what to keep in mind:ðŸ”¹ Your personal bank account remains active as long as: â€“ Your contact details are up to date with the bank, or â€“ Youâ€™re still using the account (for financial or even non-financial transactions).ðŸ”¹ Under UAE Central Bank rules, your account is only considered dormant if: â€“ There's been no activity for 3 years, and â€“ You haven't contacted the bank in that time.ðŸ”¹ After resigning and cancelling your employment visa: â€“ Your account can still be used, but may be reclassified as a non-resident account. â€“ Terms and conditions might change depending on your residency status.ðŸ’¡ Planning to start your own business? â€“ Once your company is registered, you can open a corporate bank account. â€“ Transferring funds from your personal to your corporate account is allowedâ€”just keep documentation for compliance and transparency. â€“ Inform your bank about your business plans and visa status for smoother processing.âœ¨ Pro Tip: Stay in touch with your bank throughout your transition. Dubaiâ€™s position as a neutral hub attracts capital from Asia, Europe, and beyond, diversifying exposure and insulating it from single-market shocks.Growth > Oversupply? Smart developers are aligning supply with the future demand â€”think sustainability, luxury, and tech-integrated living.Affordability & ROI: The Sweet SpotA PIR (Price-to-Income Ratio) of ~6.7? With rental yields outperforming global averages (6-8%+), affordability concerns are balanced by tangible returns.China, Tariffs, and Dubaiâ€™s Ace CardGeopolitical tensions? Dubai thrives on neutrality. As global powers shift, investors seek safe harbors. The cityâ€™s diversification beyond oilâ€”into tech, trade, and tourismâ€”makes it resilient.Every market has risks, but Dubaiâ€™s foresightâ€”coupled with tools like strategic reinvestment and data-driven lendingâ€”helps investors turn challenges into wins. AtÂ Lion Mortgage Dubai, weâ€™re here to guide you through the nuances, from loan structuring to identifying high-potential projects.Ready to explore? Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

ðŸ”¹ UAE HR FAQ â€“ Day 52ðŸ”¹ Wage Calculation for Piecework Workers â€“ Article 23â“ How is the wage calculated for workers on a piecework basis? âœ… It is calculated based on the average earnings received by the worker during the actual working days in the past 6 months.â“ When is this calculation method applied? âœ… This method is used when a worker raises a request or claim related to their wage.â“ Does it matter if the worker had inconsistent earnings? âœ… Yes. The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Hereâ€™s what to keep in mind:ðŸ”¹ Your personal bank account remains active as long as: â€“ Your contact details are up to date with the bank, or â€“ Youâ€™re still using the account (for financial or even non-financial transactions).ðŸ”¹ Under UAE Central Bank rules, your account is only considered dormant if: â€“ There's been no activity for 3 years, and â€“ You haven't contacted the bank in that time.ðŸ”¹ After resigning and cancelling your employment visa: â€“ Your account can still be used, but may be reclassified as a non-resident account. â€“ Terms and conditions might change depending on your residency status.ðŸ’¡ Planning to start your own business? â€“ Once your company is registered, you can open a corporate bank account. â€“ Transferring funds from your personal to your corporate account is allowedâ€”just keep documentation for compliance and transparency. â€“ Inform your bank about your business plans and visa status for smoother processing.âœ¨ Pro Tip: Stay in touch with your bank throughout your transition. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

ðŸ”¹ UAE HR FAQ â€“ Day 52ðŸ”¹ Wage Calculation for Piecework Workers â€“ Article 23â“ How is the wage calculated for workers on a piecework basis? âœ… It is calculated based on the average earnings received by the worker during the actual working days in the past 6 months.â“ When is this calculation method applied? âœ… This method is used when a worker raises a request or claim related to their wage.â“ Does it matter if the worker had inconsistent earnings? âœ… Yes. The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

ðŸ”¹ UAE HR FAQ â€“ Day 52ðŸ”¹ Wage Calculation for Piecework Workers â€“ Article 23â“ How is the wage calculated for workers on a piecework basis? âœ… It is calculated based on the average earnings received by the worker during the actual working days in the past 6 months.â“ When is this calculation method applied? âœ… This method is used when a worker raises a request or claim related to their wage.â“ Does it matter if the worker had inconsistent earnings? âœ… Yes. Dubai's real estate market is evolving beyond traditional bank financing, with non-recourse structures creating unprecedented opportunities for both developers and private investors.

Username: Mubarak Ali Khan, MBA, DCT.,Mubarak Ali Khan, MBA, DCT.,
Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Hereâ€™s What You Need to Know About Your Bank Account and Starting a Business ðŸ’¼ðŸ’³If you've recently resigned and are planning to open your own company in the UAE, you might be wondering: Can I still use my personal bank account? What happens during the transition?âœ… Yes, you can continue using your account. Dubai thrives on neutrality. As global powers shift, investors seek safe harbors. The cityâ€™s diversification beyond oilâ€”into tech, trade, and tourismâ€”makes it resilient.Every market has risks, but Dubaiâ€™s foresightâ€”coupled with tools like strategic reinvestment and data-driven lendingâ€”helps investors turn challenges into wins. Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is evolving beyond traditional bank financing, with non-recourse structures creating unprecedented opportunities for both developers and private investors.

Username: Mubarak Ali Khan, MBA, DCT.,Mubarak Ali Khan, MBA, DCT.,
Post Content:
Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor

Is it legal for employers in the UAE to deduct visa costs from your salary?UAE Labour Law: Recruitment & Resignation - Know Your RightsðŸ’¸ Visa and Recruitment Costs - - Covered under Federal Decree Law No. 33 of 2021.Employers must bear all recruitment and visa-related expenses which includes- Hiring costs- Travel expenses- Visa issuance fees- Medical tests- Residency permit feesEmployees cannot be asked to pay any part of these expenses.Applies to both direct hires and those recruited via accredited agencies.âŒ Illegal Salary Deductions- Deducting money from an employeeâ€™s salary for recruitment/visa costs is prohibited by law.ðŸ“‹ Resignation Rules Can your employer deduct money if you resign?1. Resignation Without NoticeAs per Article 43 of the UAE Labour Law, if you resign without completing the notice period agreed in your contract, you are required to compensate your employer. This is known asÂ payment in lieu of noticeÂ and must be paid even if your departure causes no direct harm to the employer.2. Resignation During ProbationIf an employee resigns during probation:Employer can recover recruitment costs only if the employment contract explicitly states so.If no clause exists, the employee is not liable.Article 9: If joining a new employer, the new employer may compensate the original employer for recruitment costs, unless agreed otherwise.Reference & credits - https://lnkd.in/d-8TexbMhashtag#uae hashtag#dubai hashtag#abudhabi hashtag#laws hashtag#new #2025 hashtag#policy hashtag#corporate hashtag#payments hashtag#resignation hashtag#law hashtag#rules hashtag#regulation hashtag#employee hashtag#employer hashtag#rights hashtag#trainer hashtag#trainee hashtag#train hashtag#labor hashtag#UAELABORLAW hashtag#Emirate hashtag#emirates hashtag#policies hashtag#visa hashtag#charges hashtag#recruitment hashtag#jobs hashtag#agencies hashtag#salary hashtag#deductions hashtag#job hashtag#medical

ðŸ”¹ UAE HR FAQ â€“ Day 52ðŸ”¹ Wage Calculation for Piecework Workers â€“ Article 23â“ How is the wage calculated for workers on a piecework basis? âœ… It is calculated based on the average earnings received by the worker during the actual working days in the past 6 months.â“ When is this calculation method applied? âœ… This method is used when a worker raises a request or claim related to their wage.â“ Does it matter if the worker had inconsistent earnings? âœ… Yes. The law considers the average wage over six months, ensuring fairness despite varying outputs.ðŸ“Œ Key Takeaway: For piecework-based employees, the wage calculation for disputes or claims is averaged over the last 6 months, not just recent earnings.hashtag#UAEHR hashtag#PieceworkWages hashtag#MOHRE hashtag#LabourLawUAE hashtag#HRFAQ hashtag#SalaryCalculation

Dubai's real estate market is currently experiencing dynamic growth and evolving trends. 1. Record-Breaking Sales: In Q1 2025, Dubai's property market achieved historic highs with 45,474 transactions worth AED 142.7 billion. This represents a 22% increase in transaction volume and a 30% rise in value compared to the same period last year2. Shift from Renting to Ownership:Rising rental prices are encouraging residents to consider homeownership. The ready property segment saw its strongest quarterly performance ever, with 20,034 transactions totaling AED 87.5 billionâ€”a 21% increase in volume and a 34% rise in value year-on-year3. Off-Plan Market Growth: Off-plan sales accounted for 56% of all transactions, with 25,440 sales worth AED 55.2 billion. This marks a 24% increase from Q1 2024, driven by attractive payment plans and opportunities for capital appreciation4. High Rental Yields: Dubai remains a top global city for rental returns, with average yields of approximately 7%, attracting international investors.5. Emerging Communities:Limited land availability in established neighborhoods has led to the rise of master-planned communities like Emaar South, The Valley, and DAMAC Island. These areas are gaining popularity despite being on the city's fringes.6. Luxury Market Boom: High-net-worth individuals are drawn to luxury properties in areas like Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Marina, Downtown Dubai, and Arabian Ranches. Villa prices in DAMAC Hills have seen significant increases, with transactional prices rising by up to 21%.7. Sustainability and Smart Development: Green and smart technologies are reshaping the market, aligning with Dubai's Vision 2030 and sustainability goals.8. Global Investor Confidence: Factors like tax-free income, political stability, and a weakening US dollar are making Dubai properties more attractive to international buyersMubarak Dubai Realtor
